quotes.quote: It is only through shadows that one comes to know the light.
Most of the shadows of this life are caused by standing in one's own sunshine.
Even the purest cast a black shadow.
The shadow that hidden, repressed, for the most part inferior and guilt - laden personality whose ultimate ramifications reach back into the realm of our annual ancestors.
Unless you learn to face your own shadows, you will continue to see them in others, because the world outside you is only a reflection of the world inside you.
If you don't have any shadows you're not in the light.
Everyone carries a shadow, and the less it is embodied in the individual's conscious life, the blacker and denser it is.
To confront a person with his shadow is to show him his own light.
The brightest flame casts the darkest shadow.
We are linked by our shadows, not by our light.
Everything that we see is a shadow cast by that which we do not see.
Light and shadow are opposite sides of the same coin. We can illuminate our paths or darken our way. It is a matter of choice.
The true work of art is but a shadow of the divine perfection.
There is strong shadow where there is much light.
Befriend your shadow and life will be easier.
I like my shadow; it reminds me that I exist.
There is no light without shadow, just as there is no happiness without pain.
Somethings can only be seen in the shadows.
Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
Every light has its shadow, and every shadow hath a succeeding morning.
We think not in words but in shadows of words.
Shadow owes its birth to light.
To light a candle is to cast a shadow.
Shadow is a colour as light is, but less brilliant; light and shadow are only the relation of two tones.
Glory follows virtue as if it were its shadow.
One can live in the shadow of an idea without grasping it.
The brighter the light, the deeper the shadow.
